data.question: What is the Schläfli symbol for the first uniform net containing only planar four-coordinate nodes?
What reaction conditions lead to the formation of α-Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2?
data.answer: Reaction of NiCl2·6H2O with 3-(3-pyridyl)acrylic acid (pyaraH) and NaOH in water at 180 °C for 24 hours under hydrothermal conditions.

data.question: True or False: The β-Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2 polymorph forms at a lower temperature than α-Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2.
What is the yield of α-Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2 when synthesized under its specific conditions?
By changing the reaction temperature, how does the structure of Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2 change?
data.answer: At 180 °C, it forms a 3D polymeric structure with a self-penetrating, four-coordinate (8,4) network, while at 150 °C, it forms 1D chains hydrogen bonded into a 3D network.

data.question: True or False: The structure of α-Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2 contains only one type of Ni atom.
What unique feature does the (8,4) network of α-Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2 exhibit?
True or False: The β-Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2 polymorph has a higher yield than α-Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2 when synthesized under its specific conditions.
What is the role of hydrogen bonding in the structure of α-Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2?
data.answer: Hydrogen bonding between the uncoordinated oxygen atoms of the carboxylates and the coordinated water molecules plays an important role in directing the network topology.

data.question: True or False: The (8,4) network topology has been previously recognized before this study.
What distinguishes the (8,4) network in α-Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2 from other reported network topologies?
data.answer: It is the first uniform net to contain only planar four-coordinate nodes and does not have the Schläfli symbol 6^6.

data.question: True or False: The β-Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2 polymorph forms 1D chains that are not interconnected.
How does the coordination environment of Ni atoms in α-Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2 contribute to its network topology?
data.answer: Ni atoms act as four-coordinate planar centers with trans pyara ligands bridging between them, contributing to the (8,4) network topology.

data.question: True or False: The reaction temperature has no effect on the polymorph of Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2 that forms.
What is the significance of the self-penetrating feature of the (8,4) network in α-Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2?
data.answer: It indicates that its shortest circuits are penetrated by rods of the same network, a feature that is unique among uniform networks.

data.question: True or False: All nodes in the (8,4) network of α-Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2 have 90° angles.
What distinguishes the β-Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2 polymorph's structure from that of α-Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2?
data.answer: β-Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2 consists of 1D chains of metal centers bridged by pyara ligands, in contrast to the 3D polymeric structure of α-Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2.

data.question: True or False: The α-Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2 and β-Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2 polymorphs have identical crystal structures.
What is the yield of β-Ni(pyara)2(H2O)2 when synthesized under its specific conditions?
How do the hydrothermal reaction conditions influence the diversity of M−pyara networks?
data.answer: Variation in reaction temperature directs the formation of different polymorphs, demonstrating the influence of hydrothermal conditions on the diversity of M−pyara networks.
